vulnerabilities.title: XML External Entity (XXE) Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `expat` package and not the `expat` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

In libexpat in Expat before 2.2.7, XML input including XML names that contain a large number of colons could make the XML parser consume a high amount of RAM and CPU resources while processing (enough to be usable for denial-of-service attacks).
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `expat` to version 2.2.7-r0 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.name: expat/expat

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `expat` package and not the `expat` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

In libexpat before 2.2.8, crafted XML input could fool the parser into changing from DTD parsing to document parsing too early; a consecutive call to XML_GetCurrentLineNumber (or XML_GetCurrentColumnNumber) then resulted in a heap-based buffer over-read.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `expat` to version 2.2.7-r1 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Reachable Assertion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `krb5` package and not the `krb5` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `krb5` to version 1.15.4-r0 or higher.
## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)

- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/09/msg00019.html)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)

vulnerabilities.title: Key Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libressl` package and not the `libressl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

During key agreement in a TLS handshake using a DH(E) based ciphersuite a malicious server can send a very large prime value to the client. This will cause the client to spend an unreasonably long period of time generating a key for this prime resulting in a hang until the client has finished. ## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libressl` package and not the `libressl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._

vulnerabilities.name: libressl/libressl2.6-libcrypto

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libressl` package and not the `libressl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

Libgcrypt before 1.7.10 and 1.8.x before 1.8.3 allows a memory-cache side-channel attack on ECDSA signatures that can be mitigated through the use of blinding during the signing process in the _gcry_ecc_ecdsa_sign function in cipher/ecc-ecdsa.c, aka the Return Of the Hidden Number Problem or ROHNP. To discover an ECDSA key, the attacker needs access to either the local machine or a different virtual machine on the same physical host.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libressl` to version 2.6.5-r0 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libressl` package and not the `libressl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

During key agreement in a TLS handshake using a DH(E) based ciphersuite a malicious server can send a very large prime value to the client. This will cause the client to spend an unreasonably long period of time generating a key for this prime resulting in a hang until the client has finished. This could be exploited in a Denial Of Service attack. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.0i-dev (Affected 1.1.0-1.1.0h). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2p-dev (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2o).

Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libressl` to version 2.6.5-r0 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libressl` package and not the `libressl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

Libgcrypt before 1.7.10 and 1.8.x before 1.8.3 allows a memory-cache side-channel attack on ECDSA signatures that can be mitigated through the use of blinding during the signing process in the _gcry_ecc_ecdsa_sign function in cipher/ecc-ecdsa.c, aka the Return Of the Hidden Number Problem or ROHNP. To discover an ECDSA key, the attacker needs access to either the local machine or a different virtual machine on the same physical host.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libressl` to version 2.6.5-r0 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Key Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libressl` package and not the `libressl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

During key agreement in a TLS handshake using a DH(E) based ciphersuite a malicious server can send a very large prime value to the client. This will cause the client to spend an unreasonably long period of time generating a key for this prime resulting in a hang until the client has finished. This could be exploited in a Denial Of Service attack. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.0i-dev (Affected 1.1.0-1.1.0h). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2p-dev (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2o).
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libressl` to version 2.6.5-r0 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `musl` package and not the `musl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

musl libc through 1.1.23 has an x87 floating-point stack adjustment imbalance, related to the math/i386/ directory. In some cases, use of this library could introduce out-of-bounds writes that are not present in an application's source code.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `musl` to version 1.1.18-r4 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-14697)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-14697)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202003-13)
- [MISC](https://www.openwall.com/lists/musl/2019/08/06/1)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/08/06/4)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `wget` package and not the `wget` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

set_file_metadata in xattr.c in GNU Wget before 1.20.1 stores a file's origin URL in the user.xdg.origin.url metadata attribute of the extended attributes of the downloaded file, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information (e.g., credentials contained in the URL) by reading this attribute, as demonstrated by getfattr. This also applies to Referer information in the user.xdg.referrer.url metadata attribute. According to 2016-07-22 in the Wget ChangeLog, user.xdg.origin.url was partially based on the behavior of fwrite_xattr in tool_xattr.c in curl.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `wget` to version 1.20.1-r0 or higher.
## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20483)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20483)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201903-08)
- [MISC](http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/wget.git/tree/NEWS)
